ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Hyperacusis and Tinnitus
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Normal hearing sensitivity with significantly reduced Loudness Discomfort Levels (50–60 dB HL) and tinnitus onset following an acoustic shock event.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Assess hearing thresholds following acoustic shock.
Evaluate speech reception and recognition abilities.
Quantify sound sensitivity and dynamic range.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presented with normal pure-tone thresholds and excellent speech recognition bilaterally. Immittance testing could not be performed due to the patient's extreme sensitivity to pressure and sound. Loudness Discomfort Levels were significantly reduced (50–60 dB HL), confirming hyperacusis.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal limits (0–10 dB HL) from 250 to 8000 Hz bilaterally.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs (RT 7 dB, LT 5 dB) consistent with PTA; WRS 100% at 40 dB HL bilaterally.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Not performed due to patient sensitivity to pressure and sound.

proposed_items: Fit with BTE sound generators for sound therapy
Hearing protection in hazardous noise only
counseling_actions: Advise against overprotection (avoid constant use of earplugs/muffs in non-hazardous situations)
Explain hyperacusis and the goal of desensitization

escalation.rationale_short: To address fear of sound (phonophobia) and anxiety related to tinnitus.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing thresholds and tolerance to sound.
